devdoc.details: This contract represents the logic and data for each game on the platform. It implements an public interface and the ownable pattern so most operations can only be executed  by the owner (the CryptoArcade contract) to reduce the attacking surface.  * There is a circuit breaker implemented that can only be operated by the owner  account, in case a serious issue is detected.

activateGame().details: This methods activates the game, enabling most of its functionality. The game can be deactivated without being destroyed, in case an issue is detected. The method can only be invoked by the owner contract.
activateGame().return: The match ID of the match bought

constructor.details: Creates a new instance associated to the game creator address and sets the price players will have to pay to play.

params._creator: The account address of the game creator

deactivateGame().details: This methods deactivates the game, disabling most of its functionality. The game can be deactivated without being destroyed, in case an issue is detected. The method can only be invoked by the owner contract.
deactivateGame().return: The match ID of the match bought

gameMatchPrice().details: This methods retrieves the price per match in wei.
gameMatchPrice().return: The price per match in wei

getMatchPrice().details: Method that retrieves the price per match in wei
getMatchPrice().return: The price per match in wei

getNumberOfAvailableMatches(address).details: This method returns player's number of matches in NotPlayed status.
getNumberOfAvailableMatches(address).return: The number of matches that are in NotPlayed status

getRecordEntryAddress(uint256).details: Method that retrieves the top 10 ranking one piece of data at a time,  to avoid complex operations on-chain.
getRecordEntryAddress(uint256).return: The address of the entry in the top 10 'pos' position

getRecordEntryScore(uint256).details: Method that retrieves the top 10 ranking one piece of data at a time,  to avoid complex operations on-chain.
getRecordEntryScore(uint256).return: The score of the entry in the top 10 'pos' position

getReleasedAmount(address).details: The amount of Ether already released to a payee.

isActive().details: This methods retrieves the state of the game. The game can be deactivated without being removed, in case an issue is detected.

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

matchPlayed(address,uint256).details: This method stores the score of a match played, calculates whether it falls in the top 10 in which case it also calculates and awards a number of shares to the player. How many depends on the position achieved.     * The method emits a match played event.
matchPlayed(address,uint256).return: The number of shares produced by the score (zero if the score doesn't make it to the top 10)

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

playMatch(address).details: This method flags a match as played, which consumes it. The status of the match becomes Played so its score can be associated to it.
playMatch(address).return: The match ID of the match played

playerBalance(address).details: Method that returns the number of shares of a given player in the common game reward pot.
playerBalance(address).return: The number of shares for the given player in the reward pot

purchaseMatch(address).details: This method purchases a match for a player. It can only be called from the owner's arcade contract and returns any excess ether paid. The paid ether is transferred to the contract that mamanges the rewards.
purchaseMatch(address).return: The match ID of the match bought

releaseReward(address).details: Method that pays to the player the ether corresponding to the number of shares as a % representation on the total.
releaseReward(address).return: The amount of ether in wei paid to the player

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * > Note: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: CryptoArcadeGame
